lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/simon.Simon.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run simon.Simon.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-graphics', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
Simon is a desktop app for managing tasks through the use of a Graphical User Interface (GUI)
Description: Adds a deadline task with a specific due date.\
Explanation: Adds a task with the description "Finish homework" and a deadline of September 15, 2024, at 23:59.
Description: Adds an event with a start and end time.\
Explanation: Adds an event with the description "Team meeting," starting on September 14, 2024, at 09:00 and ending on the same day at 11:00.
Description: Adds a to-do task with a description.\
Explanation: Adds a to-do task with the description "Buy groceries."
Description: Deletes a task by index.\
Explanation: Deletes the task at index 3.
Description: Searches for tasks by title.\
Explanation: Searches for tasks that contain "project" in their title.
Description: Displays a list of all tasks.\
Description: Marks a task as completed.\
Explanation: Marks the task at index 1 as completed.
Description: Marks a task as not completed.\
Explanation: Marks the task at index 2 as not completed.
Invalid Commands: If an unrecognized command is entered, you will be prompted to correct your input.
* Represents a command in the Simon application.
* Each command implements this interface to define its own execution behavior.
* Executes the command with the given task list, user interface, and storage.
* @param taskList the list of tasks to be manipulated by the command
* @param ui the user interface to interact with the user
* @param storage the storage to save or retrieve data
public String execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage);
* Represents a task with a specific deadline in the Simon application.
* Inherits from the Task class and adds a deadline property.

public String execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) {

* @return a string representation of the Events task in the format "E | completed | name | from | to"
* Represents a command to find tasks that contain a specific keyword.

* @param name The keyword to search for in the tasks.

* @param ui The UI object used to display the search results.
* @param storage The storage object used for loading and saving tasks (not used in this command).
* @return A string representing the search results.

* the dialog container. Clears the user input after processing.

* @param ui the user interface used to show feedback to the user

return "OK, I've marked this task as not done yet: \n" + task.toString();
* Displays a message indicating that a task has been deleted and returns it.

public String showTaskDeleted(Task task, int taskCount) {
assert task != null : "task cannot be null";
System.out.print(printMessage("Noted. I've removed this task:\n" + "\t" + task.toString())
+ "\tNow you have " + taskCount + " tasks in the list.");
return ("Noted. I've removed this task: " + task.toString())
+ "\nNow you have " + taskCount + " tasks in the list.";
